title: How to Meet or Contact Jojo Siwa in Person, Online, or by Mail

steps.title: No, JoJo doesn’t have a public phone number or email address.
steps.content: No, JoJo doesn’t have a public phone number or email address. While you can’t call or email JoJo directly, you can text 1 (310) 777-0776 to join her Community—a text messaging platform that allows celebrities to connect with their fans. Members of JoJo’s team likely manage this number, which means you’re receiving automated updates. [1] X Research source If phone or email is your preferred method of communication, contact her management team, Creative Artists Agency (CAA) at: CAA email: info@caa.com CAA phone: 1 (424) 288-2000 .

steps.title: Leave a comment or direct message JoJo on her social media accounts.
steps.content: Leave a comment or direct message JoJo on her social media accounts. The only official pages run by JoJo and her team include: Instagram TikTok Facebook X (formerly known as Twitter)

steps.title: Send fan mail and autograph requests to her official fan mail address.
steps.content: Send fan mail and autograph requests to her official fan mail address. If you want to write JoJo a personal letter, compliment her music, or request an autographed photo, address it to: JoJo Siwa 501 West Glenoaks #34 Glendale, CA 91202 USA

steps.title: Be sincere and include a return envelope to get a response.
steps.content: Be sincere and include a return envelope to get a response. Briefly introduce yourself and explain what JoJo’s work means to you. Whether it’s about her music, dancing, or activism, get specific about her impact to make your message more meaningful. Finish off with a polite request to return your letter, send an autograph, or answer one of your burning questions. [2] X Research source When writing fan mail , use conversational language to showcase your personality. For example, instead of saying “I love your new single,” you could say, “I have Karma on repeat—because it’s such a BOP! I can’t wait for more music in this new era.” To make your letter stand out (and increase the likelihood of it being read), decorate the outside of your envelope with stamps and stickers, or write JoJo’s name in calligraphy . If you’re requesting an autograph, send your photo in a properly stamped and self addressed envelope. It typically takes 3+ months for a response, so try your best to be patient. [3] X Research source In the meantime, send fan mail to Jenna Ortega , Johnny Depp , or another celebrity you admire!

steps.title: Talent Agents: Shauna Perlman & Donovan Tatum at CAA
steps.content: Talent Agents: Shauna Perlman & Donovan Tatum at CAA For general inquiries, send an email to info@caa.com and ask to be connected with Shauna Perlman. If you want to book JoJo for a commercial opportunity, contact her commercial talent agent, Donovan Tatum, at donovan.tatum@caa.com . Send mail and general phone calls to: [4] X Research source CAA 2000 Avenue of the Stars Los Angeles, CA 90067 USA Phone: 1 (424) 288-2000

steps.title: Legal Representation: Goodman, Genow, Schenkman, Smelkinson & Christopher
steps.content: Legal Representation: Goodman, Genow, Schenkman, Smelkinson & Christopher For contract negotiations, copyright issues, and licensing agreements, reach out to JoJo’s legal representatives, Chad M. Christopher or John Ingram, at chad@ggssc.com or johni@ggssc.com . Send mail or make a call at: [5] X Research source 9665 Wilshire Blvd. 5th Floor Beverly Hills, CA 90212 USA Phone: 1 (310) 385-9300

steps.title: Red carpet appearances
steps.content: Red carpet appearances If you want to catch JoJo in real life (and possibly snag an autograph or photo together), search for her upcoming appearances on Google. Find out when and where the event will be, and show up early to get a spot near the barricade. [6] X Research source moviepremierewithoutticket.html Previously, JoJo has attended events like the People’s Choice Awards, iHeartRadio Music Awards, and American Music Awards.

steps.title: Charity events
steps.content: Charity events JoJo is known as an LGBTQ+ role model and advocate for childhood cancer research, and she even has her own non-profit organization, The JoJo Siwa Childhood Cancer Foundation. She’s participated in charity events for Dancers Against Cancer and Ping Pong 4 Purpose in the past, so check her social media accounts to stay up to date on her upcoming schedule.
